program_description: The Agriculture Innovation Center Program (AICP) awards grants to eligible Agriculture Innovation Centers that help ag producers develop and market value-added agricultural products.
value_added_activity_1: Jams and jellies made from produce grown on your farm
value_added_activity_2: Textiles woven from fleece harvested on your ranch
funds_use_general: Grant and matching funds can be used to operate Agriculture Innovation Centers, and to provide services to eligible ag producers.
funds_use_example_1: Business development services such as creating feasibility studies and business plans
funds_use_example_2: Marketing services such as developing marketing plans, branding, and customer identification
funds_use_example_3: Organizational assistance such as legal and technical advisory services for business development, operation, or expansion
funds_use_example_4: Financial advisory services, including such things as finding credit for operating costs, training on financial management software systems, and cash flow guidance
funds_use_example_5: Process development services including engineering, scale production assessments, and systems development
funds_use_example_6: Product development such as idea generation, concept testing, and consumer analysis, including demographics and brand development
funds_use_example_7: Value chain coordination such as connecting ag producers to distribution systems, processing facilities, or commercial kitchens
grant_term_individual_limit: Individual grants to agricultural producers cannot exceed $5,000
getting_started_step_1: The first step is to ensure your organization has a valid, free, Unique Entity Identifier (UEI) in the System for Award Management (SAM).
getting_started_step_2: Before you register for this free service, we encourage you to read the SAM.gov help materials available at this link: tinyurl.com/SAM-Help.
governing_authority: The AICP is authorized by 7 CFR 4284, Subpart K
note_general_info: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
